#include<stdio.h>
#include<string.h>
typedef struct store
{
	int value,weight;
}store;
store result[200];

void intialise(int *array)
{
	array['Z'-'A'] = 1;
	array['Q'-'A'] = 3;
	array['E'-'A'] = 5;
	array['T'-'A'] = 7;
	array['U'-'A'] = 9;
}

void bubblesort(int low,int high)
{
	int i,j;
	store tmp;
	for(i = low;i < high;i++)
	{
		for(j = i+1;j <= high;j++)
		{
			if(result[i].weight >= result[j].weight)
			{
				tmp = result[j];
				result[j] = result[i];
				result[i] = tmp;
			}
		}
	}
}

int main()
{
	int n,i,num1,num2,k,last_seen,limit;
	char input[200];
	int values[26];
	intialise(values);
	scanf("%d",&n);
	while(n--)
	{
		scanf("%s",input);
		limit = strlen(input);
		k = 0;
		i = 0;
		num1 = 0;
		while(1)
		{
			if(input[i] >= '0' && input[i] <= '9')
			{
				last_seen = input[i++] - '0';
				break;
			}
			num1 += values[input[i]-'A'];
			i++;
		}
		num2 = 0;
		while(i < limit)
		{
			if(input[i] >= '0' && input[i] <= '9')
			{
				result[k].value = last_seen;
				result[k++].weight = num1 - num2;
				last_seen = input[i] - '0';
				num1 = num2;
				num2 = 0;
			}
			else
				num2 += values[input[i]-'A'];
			i++;
		}
		result[k].value = last_seen;
		result[k].weight = num1 - num2;
		bubblesort(0,k);
		for(i = 0;i <= k;i++)
			printf("%d",result[i].value);
		printf("\n");
	}
	return 0;
}
